As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience. However, here are some general tips that can help:

1. Avoid instilling fear: When talking to your children about safety, it is essential to avoid using scary language or making them feel anxious. Instead, focus on empowering them with information and skills to help them stay safe.

2. Use age-appropriate language: Use language that is clear and easy for your children to understand. Use age-appropriate examples to illustrate the points you are making.

3. Teach by example: Children learn by watching and imitating their parents. If you display safe behavior, it is more likely that your children will learn to do the same.

4. Provide clear instructions: Provide your children with clear instructions on how to stay safe. For example, if you are teaching them to cross the road safely, show them how to look both ways and only cross when it is safe to do so.

5. Explain the consequences: Explain the consequences of unsafe behavior. For example, if they ride their bike without a helmet, explain what could happen if they fall and hurt themselves.

6. Encourage questions: Encourage your children to ask questions so that they can understand the importance of safety and injury prevention.

7. Reinforce positive behavior: When your children display safe behavior, reinforce it by praising and rewarding them. This will encourage them to continue to behave in a safe manner.
